intro: Echinopsis chiloensis, commonly known as the Chiloé cactus, is a species native to Chile. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its ribbed stems and spiny areoles. The plant produces large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom at night. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil. Echinopsis chiloensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry climates.
